content:
**Addition**
> Humors
Every player has 4 humors, Red, Blue, Yellow and Black. Each of a player’s Humors must be within 10 points of each other for the player to be considered “Balanced”. If each of a player’s Humors is the exact same value, the player is considered to be in a state of “Eukrasia”, unless all of the humors are at the value 0, then the player is considered to be in “Unholy Eukrasia”. If all of a player’s humors are within 20 points of each other, they are “Unbalanced”, and if they do not fall into any of the above categories, they are considered to be “Fatally Unbalanced”. Each player starts with 29 + 1d4 of each humor.

**Addition**
> Winning
If a player synthesises Gold while in Eukrasia, they win BS Nomic Season 4. If a player synthesises Gold with Lead as the base material and they are not in Unholy Eukrasia or considered Fatally Unbalanced, they win BS Nomic Season 4.

**Addition**
> Humors
Every player has 4 humors, Red, Blue, Yellow and Black. Each of a player’s Humors must be within 10 points of each other for the player to be considered “Balanced”. If each of a player’s Humors is the exact same value, the player is considered to be in a state of “Eukrasia”, unless all of the humors are at the value 0, then the player is considered to be in “Unholy Eukrasia”. If all of a player’s humors are within 20 points of each other and do not fall into any of the above categories, they are “Unbalanced”, and if they do not fall into any of the above categories, they are considered to be “Fatally Unbalanced”. Each player starts with 29 + 1d4 of each humor.

**Addition:** __Oscillations__
A singular Oscillation is a week (168 hours), commencing every Sunday at 00:00:00 UTC (<t:1675555200:T>). When this proposition is added it is deemed to be part-way through the first oscillation.

**Content Appendication:** __(#25) Humors__
Humor points are always integers and are rounded to the nearest integer if a rule would provide for the possibility of real, non-integer values.

**Addition:** __Definitely Not Magic__
Any active player may become or un-become a Plague Doctor candidate at any time (either by stating so in the Blue Sheep Nomic server or reacting to a/the designated message).
At the start of every Oscillation (or slightly in advance), A random Plague Doctor candidate excluding the Plague Doctor of the previous Oscillation is selected as the Plague Doctor of this Oscillation. Whilst there is only 1 Plague Doctor candidate, they are always the Plague Doctor. Should there be 0, spells cannot be submitted.

If a Plague Doctor candidate becomes inactive they are no longer a Plague Doctor candidate.

It is the Plague Doctor's role to be DMed the Spells performed by each player and apply their effects. If an action is not clear or there is a matter relating to the spells performed that would ordinarily be resulved via Judge, the Plague Doctor instead decides how to interpret the rules.

The Plague Doctor cannot perform spells nor be targeted by spells in the Oscillation that they are the Plague Doctor.

If the Plague Doctor does not perform their task to completion before the conclusion of the following (next) Oscillation, the spells from that Oscillation are instead not performed and play resumes with a new Plague Doctor in the next (next next) Oscillation.

After completing the updated humors, Spell Priority and effects of all players, the Plague Doctor must send this information to the Blue Sheep Nomic Server.

**Addition:** __Spell Priority__
Each player starts with a Spell Priority of 0. Spell Priority is always an integer and is rounded to the nearest integer if a rule makes it not.
The order spells (within spell slots) are performed in is determined by Spell Priority, with the player's spells being performed from highest to lowest Spell Priority. If multiple players have the same Spell Priority, the order between these players is random.

**Addition:** __Submitting Spells__
Each player can DM the Plague Doctor up to 3 spells in any of the 3 'spell slots'. Any spell slot that is not filled with a spell at the end of the Oscillation is replaced by the 'Wait' spell. The spells in the slots are resolved sequentially with all slot 1 spells being performed before slot 2, and finally, 3.

**Addition:** __Spells__
Spells are divided into Basic spells and Humoral spells. Humoral spells are further divided into lower (1), mid (2) and higher (3) spells respectively. A spell can be categorised as multiple or none of these classifications.

**Addition:** __Basic Spells__
**Imbue:**
Cost: 5 points (any singular humor).
The caster chooses a humor then selects a player. This player then gains 7 points in the selected humor.

**Purge:**
Cost: 5 points (any singular humor).
The caster chooses a humor then selects a player. This player then loses 7 points in the selected humor.

**Transfuse:**
Cost: 0 points (any singular humor).
Select a player and 2 humors. Deduct 1d10 from the first humor and add the same value to the second humor.

**Concentrate:**
Cost: 0 points.
Select a player and a humor. Add 1d10 points.

**Dilution:**
Cost: 0 points.
Select a player and a humor. Subtract 1d10 points.

**Cure:**
Cost: 7 points (any singular humor).
The caster selects a player. This player has all effects removed from them. If you target yourself increase your Spell Priority by 2.

**Quick Attack:**
Cost: 15 points (any singular humor).
This spell is performed as if you had +100 Spell Priority. Select a Basic Spell and perform it's action.

**Wait:**
Cost: 0 points.
This spell does nothing.

**Miscellaneous Change:**
> If the Rule titled "__Basic Spells__" exists, remove "a player and" from under "**Transfuse**", remove "a player and" from under "**Concentrate**" and remove "a player and" from under "**Dilution**".

**Miscellaneous Change:**
> In the Rule titled "__Basic Spells__", replace "0 points" from under "**Concentrate**" and "**Dilution**" with "3 points (any singular humor).". Remove "(any singular humor)" from under "**Transfuse**".

**Miscellaneous Change:**
> In the Rule titled "__Basic Spells__", replace "0 points" from under "**Concentrate**" and "**Dilution**" with "2 points (any singular humor).". Remove "(any singular humor)" from under "**Transfuse**".

**Content Edit:** __Definitely Not Magic__
Any player may become or un-become a Plague Doctor candidate at any time (by stating so in the Blue Sheep Nomic server).

At the start of every Oscillation (or slightly in advance), A random Plague Doctor candidate excluding the Plague Doctor of the previous Oscillation is selected as the Plague Doctor of this Oscillation. Whilst there is only 1 Plague Doctor candidate, they are always the Plague Doctor. Should there be 0, spells cannot be submitted.

It is the Plague Doctor's role to be DMed the Spells performed by each player and apply their effects. If an action is not clear or there is a matter relating to the spells performed that would ordinarily be resolved via Judge, the Plague Doctor instead decides how to interpret the rules.

The Plague Doctor cannot perform spells in the Oscillation that they are the Plague Doctor.

If the Plague Doctor does not perform their task to completion before the conclusion of the following (next) Oscillation, the spells from that Oscillation are instead not performed and play resumes with a new Plague Doctor in the next (next next) Oscillation. This (failed) Plague Doctor is removed as a Plague Doctor candidate.

After updating the Humors, updating Spell Priority, and applying Effects to all players, the Plague Doctor must send this information to the Blue Sheep Nomic server.

**Content Edit**
> #18 - Player Activity
All players are always active.

**Miscellaneous Change:** __Definitely Not Magic__
> Replace:
"At the start of every Oscillation (or slightly in advance), A random Plague Doctor candidate excluding the Plague Doctor of the previous Oscillation is selected as the Plague Doctor of this Oscillation. Whilst there is only 1 Plague Doctor candidate, they are always the Plague Doctor. Should there be 0, spells cannot be submitted."
with:
"During every Oscillation (or slightly in advance), A random Plague Doctor candidate excluding the Plague Doctor of the previous Oscillation is selected as the Plague Doctor of this Oscillation. If there are no Plague Doctor candidates there is no Plague Doctor for that Oscillation unless someone becomes a Plague Doctor candidate. In which case, they are the Plague Doctor. Whilst there is only 1 Plague Doctor candidate, they are the Plague Doctor each Oscillation. No spells can be submitted without a Plague Doctor."
